title: U.S. New Home Sales Edged Down in September
text:
By Sarah Chaney

New-home sales in the U.S. declined in September from the prior month. Here are key details from Thursday's Commerce Department report:

--Purchases of newly built single-family homes fell 0.7% to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 701,000 in September from the prior month, the Commerce Department said Thursday. Economists surveyed by The Wall Street Journal expected a sales pace of 709,000 in September.

--The number of new homes for sale in September would last 5.5 months at the current pace, down from 6.4 a year earlier.

--The median sale price of a new home in September was $299,400, which was down from last year, when the sale price was $328,300.

--Sales data can be volatile and subject to revisions. The September decrease in new-home sales carried a margin of error of plus or minus 16.1 percentage point. Sales in August were revised down to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 706,000 from an initial estimate of 713,000.

Write to Sarah Chaney at sarah.chaney@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 24, 2019 10:15 ET (14:15 GMT)
